00051 /*****************************************************************************/
00052 /**
00053 *
00054 * @file xosd.h
00055 *
00056 * This is main header file of the Xilinx MVI On-Screen-Display (OSD) device
00057 * driver.
00058 *
00059 * An OSD is an image superimposed on a screen picture, commonly used by modern
00060 * televisions, VCRs, and DVD players to display information such as volume,
00061 * channel, and time.
00062 *
00063 * Xilinx MVI OSD has the following main features:
00064 *
00065 * - Read Video Data one of three sources
00066 *       - VFBC/Frame Buffer
00067 *       - VideoBus
00068 *       - Graphics Controller
00069 * - Alpha Compositing and Alpha Blending of up to 8 layers
00070 * - Up to 8 priorities, one for each of the layers
00071 * - Real-Time Graphics Controller
00072 * - Write Composited Video Data to either
00073 *       - VFBC/Frame Buffer, or
00074 *       - VideoBus
00075 *
00076 * For a full description of OSD features, please see the hardware spec.
00077 *
00078 * <b>Interrupt Service </b>
00079 *
00080 * Four interrupt types are supported:
00081 *
00082 * - Vertical Blank Interval Start Interrupt
00083 * - Vertical Blank Interval End Interrupt
00084 * - Frame Done Interrupt
00085 * - Error Interrupt
00086 *
00087 * <b>Software Initialization </b>
00088 *
00089 * Please follow the example provided with this driver for the steps
00090 * to use this driver.
00091 *
00092 * <b>Cache Coherency</b>
00093 *
00094 * <b>Alignment</b>
00095 *
00096 * <b>Limitations</b>
00097 *
00098 * <b>BUS Interface</b>
00099 *
00100 * <pre>
00101 * MODIFICATION HISTORY:
00102 *
00103 * Ver   Who  Date     Changes
00104 * ----- ---- -------- -------------------------------------------------------
00105 * 1.00a xd   08/18/08 First release
00106 * 1.01a xd   07/30/10 Added device version support; Supported doxygen; Fixed
00107 *                     CR #534952
00108 * 1.02a xd   12/21/10 Removed endian conversion for text bank loading
00109 * 1.03a cm   09/07/11 Updated XOSD_GetLayerAlpha(), XOSD_SetLayerAlpha(), 
00110 *                     XOSD_SetBackgroundColor() and XOSD_GetBackgroundColor() 
00111 *                     to allow 10 and 12 bit alpha and background colors. 
00112 * </pre>
00113 *
00114 ******************************************************************************/
00115

00130 /** @name Interrupt types for setting up callbacks
00131  *  @{
00132  */
00133 #define XOSD_HANDLER_FRAMEDONE  1        /**< Frame Done interrupt */
00134 #define XOSD_HANDLER_VBISTART   2        /**< Vertical Blank Interval Start
00135                                            *  interrupt */
00136 #define XOSD_HANDLER_VBIEND     3        /**< Vertical Blank Interval End
00137                                            *  interrupt */
00138 #define XOSD_HANDLER_ERROR      4        /**< Error condition interrupt */
00139 /*@}*/

00143 /**
00144  * OSD device configuration structure.
00145  * Each OSD device should have a configuration structure associated
00146  */
00147 typedef struct {
00148         u16 DeviceId;      /**< DeviceId is the unique ID  of the device */
00149         u32 BaseAddress;   /**< BaseAddress is the physical base address of
00150                              *  the device's registers */
00151         u16 LayerNum;      /**< The number of Layers */
00152         u16 Layer0Type;    /**< Type of Layer #0 */
00153         u16 Layer1Type;    /**< Type of Layer #1 */
00154         u16 Layer2Type;    /**< Type of Layer #2 */
00155         u16 Layer3Type;    /**< Type of Layer #3 */
00156         u16 Layer4Type;    /**< Type of Layer #4 */
00157         u16 Layer5Type;    /**< Type of Layer #5 */
00158         u16 Layer6Type;    /**< Type of Layer #6 */
00159         u16 Layer7Type;    /**< Type of Layer #7 */
00160 
00161         /**< Layer 0 */
00162         u16 Layer0InstructionMemSize;     /**< Instruction Memory Size */
00163         u16 Layer0InstructionBoxEnable;   /**< Instruction Box Enable */
00164         u16 Layer0InstructionLineEnable;  /**< Instruction Line Enable */
00165         u16 Layer0InstructionTextEnable;  /**< Instruction Text Enable */
00166         u16 Layer0ColorLutSize;           /**< Color Lut Size */
00167         u16 Layer0ColorLutMemoryType;     /**< Color Lut Memory Type */
00168         u16 Layer0FontNumChars;           /**< Font: Number of characters */
00169         u16 Layer0FontWidth;              /**< Font: Width */
00170         u16 Layer0FontHeight;             /**< Font: Height */
00171         u16 Layer0FontBitsPerPixel;       /**< Font: Number of bits per pixel
00172                                             */
00173         u16 Layer0FontAsciiOffset;        /**< Font: ASCII offset of 1st
00174                                             *  character */
00175         u16 Layer0TextNumStrings;         /**< Text: Number of Strings */
00176         u16 Layer0TextMaxStringLength;    /**< Text: Maximum length of a
00177                                             *  String */
00178 
00179         /**< Layer 1 */
00180         u16 Layer1InstructionMemSize;     /**< Instruction Memory Size */

00195                                             *  String */

00208                                             *  pixel */

00210                                             *  character */

00213                                             *  String */

00307 /**
00308  * The XOSD Layer info structure
00309  */
00310 typedef struct {
00311         u16 LayerType;                  /**< Type of the layer */
00312         u16 InstructionNum;             /**< The Number of Instructions */
00313         u16 InstructionBoxEnable;       /**< Instruction Box Enable */
00314         u16 InstructionLineEnable;      /**< Instruction Line Enable */
00315         u16 InstructionTextEnable;      /**< Instruction Text Enable */
00316         u16 ColorLutSize;               /**< Color Lut Size */
00317         u16 ColorLutMemoryType;         /**< Color Lut Memory Type */
00318         u16 FontNumChars;               /**< Font: Number of characters */
00319         u16 FontWidth;                  /**< Font: Width */
00320         u16 FontHeight;                 /**< Font: Height */
00321         u16 FontBitsPerPixel;           /**< Font: Number of bits per pixel */
00322         u16 FontAsciiOffset;            /**< Font: ASCII offset of 1st
00323                                           *  character */
00324         u16 TextNumStrings;             /**< Text: Number of Strings */
00325         u16 TextMaxStringLength;        /**< Text: Maximum length of a
00326                                           *  String */
00327 
00328 } XOSD_Layer;
00329 
00330 /**
00331  * Callback type for all interrupts except error interrupt.
00332  *
00333  * @param CallBackRef is a callback reference passed in by the upper layer
00334  *        when setting the callback functions, and passed back to the
00335  *        upper layer when the callback is invoked.
00336  */
00337 typedef void (*XOSD_CallBack) (void *CallBackRef);
00338 
00339 /**
00340  * Callback type for Error interrupt.
00341  *
00342  * @param CallBackRef is a callback reference passed in by the upper layer
00343  *        when setting the callback functions, and passed back to the
00344  *        upper layer when the callback is invoked.
00345  * @param ErrorMask is a bit mask indicating the cause of the error. Its
00346  *        value equals 'OR'ing one or more XOSD_IXR_* values defined in
00347  *        xosd_hw.h
00348  */
00349 typedef void (*XOSD_ErrorCallBack) (void *CallBackRef, u32 ErrorMask);
00350 
00351 /**
00352  * The XOSD driver instance data. An instance must be allocated for each
00353  * OSD device in use.
00354  */
00355 typedef struct {
00356         XOSD_Config Config;     /**< Hardware configuration */
00357         u32 IsReady;            /**< Device and the driver instance are
00358                                   *  initialized */
00359         int InstructionInExternalMem;   /**< Flag indicating if the instruction
00360                                              list is from external memory */
00361         u32 ScreenHeight;               /**< Screen Height of the OSD output */
00362         u32 ScreenWidth;                /**< Screen Width of the OSD output */
00363 
00364         XOSD_Layer Layers[XOSD_MAX_NUM_OF_LAYERS]; /**< Properties of layers */
00365 
00366         XOSD_CallBack VbiStartCallBack; /**< Call back for Vertical Blank
00367                                           *  Interval (VBI) Start interrupt */
00368         void *VbiStartRef;              /**< To be passed to the VBI Start
00369                                           *  interrupt callback */
00370 
00371         XOSD_CallBack VbiEndCallBack;   /**< Call back for Vertical Blank
00372                                           *  Interval (VBI) End interrupt */
00373         void *VbiEndRef;                /**< To be passed to the VBI End
00374                                           *  interrupt callback */
00375 
00376         XOSD_CallBack FrameDoneCallBack;/**< Call back for Frame Done interrupt
00377                                           */
00378         void *FrameDoneRef;             /**< To be passed to the Frame Done
00379                                           *  interrupt callback */
00380 
00381         XOSD_ErrorCallBack ErrCallBack; /**< Call back for Error interrupt */
00382         void *ErrRef;                   /**< To be passed to the Error
00383                                           *  interrupt callback */
00384 
00385 } XOSD;
00386 
00387 /**
00388  * The XOSD_Instruction data structure for holding one GC instruction.
00389  */
00390 typedef u32 XOSD_Instruction[XOSD_INS_SIZE];
00391 
00392 /***************** Macros (Inline Functions) Definitions *********************/
00393 
00394 /*****************************************************************************/
00395 /**
00396 *
00397 * This macro enables an OSD device.
00398 *
00399 * @param  InstancePtr is a pointer to the OSD device instance to be worked on.
00400 *
00401 * @return None.
00402 *
00403 * @note
00404 * C-style signature:
00405 *        void XOSD_Enable(XOSD *InstancePtr);
00406 *
00407 ******************************************************************************/
00408 #define XOSD_Enable(InstancePtr) \
00409         XOSD_WriteReg((InstancePtr)->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_CTL, \
00410                 XOSD_ReadReg((InstancePtr)->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_CTL) | \
00411                         XOSD_CTL_EN_MASK)
00412 
00413 /*****************************************************************************/
00414 /**
00415 *
00416 * This macro disables an OSD device.
00417 *
00418 * @param  InstancePtr is a pointer to the OSD device instance to be worked on.
00419 *
00420 * @return None.
00421 *
00422 * @note
00423 * C-style signature:
00424 *        void XOSD_Disable(XOSD *InstancePtr);
00425 *
00426 ******************************************************************************/
00427 #define XOSD_Disable(InstancePtr) \
00428         XOSD_WriteReg((InstancePtr)->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_CTL, \
00429                 XOSD_ReadReg((InstancePtr)->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_CTL) & \
00430                         (~XOSD_CTL_EN_MASK))
00431 
00432 /*****************************************************************************/
00433 /**
00434 *
00435 * This macro tell an OSD device to pick up the register updates.
00436 *
00437 * @param  InstancePtr is a pointer to the OSD device instance to be worked on.
00438 *
00439 * @return None.
00440 *
00441 * @note
00442 * C-style signature:
00443 *        void XOSD_RegUpdateEnable(XOSD *InstancePtr);
00444 *
00445 ******************************************************************************/
00446 #define XOSD_RegUpdateEnable(InstancePtr) \
00447         XOSD_WriteReg((InstancePtr)->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_CTL, \
00448                 XOSD_ReadReg((InstancePtr)->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_CTL) | \
00449                         XOSD_CTL_RUE_MASK)
00450 
00451 /*****************************************************************************/
00452 /**
00453 *
00454 * This macro tell an OSD device to ignore the register updates.
00455 *
00456 * @param  InstancePtr is a pointer to the OSD device instance to be worked on.
00457 *
00458 * @return None.
00459 *
00460 * @note
00461 * C-style signature:
00462 *        void XOSD_RegUpdateDisable(XOSD *InstancePtr);
00463 *
00464 ******************************************************************************/
00465 #define XOSD_RegUpdateDisable(InstancePtr) \
00466         XOSD_WriteReg((InstancePtr)->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_CTL, \
00467                 XOSD_ReadReg((InstancePtr)->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_CTL) & \
00468                         (~XOSD_CTL_RUE_MASK))
00469 
00470 /*****************************************************************************/
00471 /**
00472 *
00473 * This macro resets an OSD device.
00474 *
00475 * @param  InstancePtr is a pointer to the OSD device instance to be worked on.
00476 *
00477 * @return None.
00478 *
00479 * @note
00480 * C-style signature:
00481 *        void XOSD_Reset(XOSD *InstancePtr);
00482 *
00483 ******************************************************************************/
00484 #define XOSD_Reset(InstancePtr) \
00485 { \
00486         XOSD_WriteReg((InstancePtr)->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_RST, \
00487                           XOSD_RST_RESET); \
00488         XOSD_WriteReg((InstancePtr)->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_CTL, 0); \
00489         (InstancePtr)->InstructionInExternalMem = 0; \
00490         (InstancePtr)->ScreenHeight = 0; \
00491         (InstancePtr)->ScreenWidth = 0; \
00492 }
00493 
00494 /*****************************************************************************/
00495 /**
00496 *
00497 * This macro enables the global interrupt on an OSD device.
00498 *
00499 * @param  InstancePtr is a pointer to the OSD device instance to be worked on.
00500 *
00501 * @return None.
00502 *
00503 * @note
00504 * C-style signature:
00505 *        void XOSD_IntrEnableGlobal(XOSD *InstancePtr);
00506 *
00507 ******************************************************************************/
00508 #define XOSD_IntrEnableGlobal(InstancePtr) \
00509         XOSD_WriteReg((InstancePtr)->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_GIER, \
00510                           XOSD_GIER_GIE_MASK)
00511 
00512 /*****************************************************************************/
00513 /**
00514 *
00515 * This macro disables the global interrupt on an OSD device.
00516 *
00517 * @param  InstancePtr is a pointer to the OSD device instance to be worked on.
00518 *
00519 * @return None.
00520 *
00521 * @note
00522 * C-style signature:
00523 *        void XOSD_IntrDisableGlobal(XOSD *InstancePtr);
00524 *
00525 ******************************************************************************/
00526 #define XOSD_IntrDisableGlobal(InstancePtr) \
00527         XOSD_WriteReg((InstancePtr)->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_GIER, 0)
00528 
00529 /*****************************************************************************/
00530 /**
00531 *
00532 * This macro enables the given individual interrupt(s) on an OSD device.
00533 *
00534 * @param  InstancePtr is a pointer to the OSD device instance to be worked on.
00535 *
00536 * @param  IntrType is the type of the interrupts to enable. Use OR'ing of
00537 *         XOSD_IXR_* constants defined in xosd_hw.h to create this parameter
00538 *         value.
00539 *
00540 * @return None
00541 *
00542 * @note
00543 *
00544 * The existing enabled interrupt(s) will remain enabled.
00545 *
00546 * C-style signature:
00547 *        void XOSD_IntrEnable(XOSD *InstancePtr, u32 IntrType)
00548 *
00549 ******************************************************************************/
00550 #define XOSD_IntrEnable(InstancePtr, IntrType) \
00551         XOSD_WriteReg((InstancePtr)->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_IER, \
00552                 ((IntrType) & XOSD_IXR_ALLINTR_MASK) | \
00553                 XOSD_ReadReg((InstancePtr)->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_IER))
00554 
00555 /*****************************************************************************/
00556 /**
00557 *
00558 * This macro disables the given individual interrupt(s) on an OSD device.
00559 *
00560 * @param  InstancePtr is a pointer to the OSD device instance to be worked on.
00561 *
00562 * @param  IntrType is the type of the interrupts to disable. Use OR'ing of
00563 *         XOSD_IXR_* constants defined in xosd_hw.h to create this parameter
00564 *         value.
00565 *
00566 * @return None
00567 *
00568 * @note
00569 *
00570 * Any other interrupt not covered by parameter IntrType, if enabled before
00571 * this macro is called, will remain enabled.
00572 *
00573 * C-style signature:
00574 *        void XOSD_IntrDisable(XOSD *InstancePtr, u32 IntrType)
00575 *
00576 ******************************************************************************/
00577 #define XOSD_IntrDisable(InstancePtr, IntrType) \
00578         XOSD_WriteReg((InstancePtr)->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_IER, \
00579                 ((~(IntrType)) & XOSD_IXR_ALLINTR_MASK) & \
00580                 XOSD_ReadReg((InstancePtr)->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_IER))
00581 
00582 /*****************************************************************************/
00583 /**
00584 *
00585 * This macro returns the pending interrupts of an OSD device.
00586 *
00587 * @param  InstancePtr is a pointer to the OSD device instance to be worked on.
00588 *
00589 * @return The pending interrupts of the OSD. Use XOSD_IXR_* constants
00590 *         defined in xosd_hw.h to interpret this value.
00591 *
00592 * @note
00593 *
00594 * C-style signature:
00595 *        u32 XOSD_IntrGetPending(XOSD *InstancePtr)
00596 *
00597 ******************************************************************************/
00598 #define XOSD_IntrGetPending(InstancePtr) \
00599         (XOSD_ReadReg((InstancePtr)->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_IER) & \
00600         XOSD_ReadReg((InstancePtr)->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_ISR) & \
00601         XOSD_IXR_ALLINTR_MASK)
00602 
00603 /*****************************************************************************/
00604 /**
00605 *
00606 * This macro clears/acknowledges pending interrupts of an OSD device.
00607 *
00608 * @param  InstancePtr is a pointer to the OSD device instance to be worked on.
00609 *
00610 * @param  IntrType is the pending interrupts to clear/acknowledge. Use OR'ing
00611 *         of XOSD_IXR_* constants defined in xosd_hw.h to create this
00612 *         parameter value.
00613 *
00614 * @return None
00615 *
00616 * @note
00617 *
00618 * C-style signature:
00619 *        void XOSD_IntrClear(XOSD *InstancePtr, u32 IntrType)
00620 *
00621 ******************************************************************************/
00622 #define XOSD_IntrClear(InstancePtr, IntrType) \
00623         XOSD_WriteReg((InstancePtr)->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_ISR, \
00624                           (IntrType) & XOSD_IXR_ALLINTR_MASK)
00625

00648
